page.title: 01Review of Fraserburgh
page.content: This Domesday Block includes Fraserburgh harbour, beach and bay, extending south to the village of Cairnbulg. To the east is the North Sea whilst westwards we have the golf course, links, farmland and wooded areas. Employment is largely connected with fishing, fish processing and light engineering. Unemployment is high and Fraserburgh Ltd. was set up to combat this. Oil service industries are being introduced and a new access road to the harbour is planned. The harbour is also going to be deepened. The beach, which stretches for about 4 Km. is beautiful. This, and the harbour area, is very popular with tourists. Cairnbulg is about 3.5 miles south of Fraserburgh and is a typical quaint fishing village with winding streets.
